page.title: 05THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Seely Hall was named after the{Seely {family}from Lincolnshire who purchesed most of the village of Brook in 1859. The hall was built in 1949 and was used as a{library}for a short period of time. Now the hall is used for occasional community get-togethers such as{flower arranging classes}for the locals. The hall is open all day and every day and in the month of{ {August}there is a nature exhibition called{"LOCAL LOOK"}that is on display at the hall.The hall may look small but is the focal point of Brook. The hall is situated opposite the{village {green}and resembles a small house at first sight.
